Posts.Title: newbie

Posts.Content: Hi,   Thought I'd share my experience which may help.  I'm currently going through chemo and I live on a farm as my amazing other half is a dairy farmer. My nurse has told us to be careful and we are very strict with hand washing, keeping work clothes seperate and we have hygiene hand gel all over the place so that anyone coming from the farm into the house uses it.  I also stay away from the farm yard and the cows to minimise any risk. As well as having cows and a couple of chickens we also have 3 lovely dogs.  The farm dog lives in her own utility room and even though she accompanies me on walks (think she's keeping an eye on me, bless her) I avoid touching her or handling her - we just chat instead.  The other two live in the house and I'm just really careful with hygiene. I couldn't imagine being without them and they have definitely helped me cope as they have just carried on as normal - they don't know I'm a cancer patient although I think I smell a bit funny after chemo as they sniff me suspiciously! I suppose the only thing to consider is whether you have the energy levels required for helping a new dog settle in but I think the right dog could be a lovely distraction.  Anyway, all the best with whatever you decide.  Whether you get your dog now or after treatment you'll still end up with a lovely new friend,   Vickie xx
